description: Two strips of ocean that border the north and south of the Grand Line. The Calm Belt has no ocean currents or winds, making it impossible for non-self-propelled ships to travel through. It is also the nesting grounds for the world's largest Sea Kings.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Enter the Calm Belt
keyEvents.description: The Going Merry accidentally enters the Calm Belt and becomes stranded due to lack of wind and current.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of the Calm Belt in the anime, establishing this important geographic barrier.

keyEvents.title: Sea Kings of the Calm Belt Revealed
keyEvents.description: The crew encounters massive Sea Kings that nest in the Calm Belt, with the Going Merry landing on one's head.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates why the Calm Belt is such a formidable barrier and dangerous location.

keyEvents.title: Escape via Sea King's Sneeze
keyEvents.description: Apis causes a Sea King to sneeze by pulling its nostril hair, launching the ship across the Calm Belt to safety.
keyEvents.significance: A creative escape demonstrating the crew's resourcefulness in dangerous situations.

statusHistory.reason: Natural geographic feature that remains unchanged

description: A peaceful island in the East Blue shaped like a battleship. Home to Apis and her grandfather Bokuden, and hiding place of the ancient dragon Ryu. According to legend, the island sits above Lost Island, the Dragon's Nest that rises once every 1,000 years.

keyEvents.title: Gomu Gomu no Tsuribashi Used on Warship Island
keyEvents.description: Luffy uses his rubber body as a bridge to help Nami cross a gap on Warship Island.
keyEvents.significance: First use of this anime-only technique in a non-combat situation.

keyEvents.title: Arrival at Warship Island
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats arrive at Warship Island with Apis after escaping the Calm Belt.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction to the main setting of the Warship Island arc.

keyEvents.title: Lost Island Legend Revealed
keyEvents.description: Bokuden shares the legend that Lost Island, the Dragon's Nest, exists beneath Warship Island and rises once every 1,000 years.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the connection between Warship Island and Lost Island, central to the arc's plot.

keyEvents.title: Ryu Revealed in Cave
keyEvents.description: The crew discovers Ryu, the ancient Sennenryu dragon, hidden in a cave on Warship Island.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the secret Apis has been protecting and the reason for Marine pursuit.

statusHistory.reason: Inhabited island serving as main setting for the arc

description: Also called the Dragon's Nest. A mythical island that exists beneath Warship Island underwater and rises from the ocean once every 1,000 years. It is where the Sennenryu dragons come to die and be reborn. The island features calcified dragon remains and is shaped like ancient nesting grounds.

keyEvents.title: Lost Island Legend Revealed
keyEvents.description: Bokuden shares the ancient legend of Lost Island, the sunken Dragon's Nest that rises once every millennium.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the arc's central mystery and destination, establishing the goal of helping Ryu return home.

statusHistory.reason: Lost Island exists underwater and only rises once every 1,000 years
